On 3/22/07, Dani Zweig <dani@...> wrote:
> This catches the no-tests-remain case, but it's an accident waiting to
> happen if the test is atomic.  The condition really ought to be
> "getDescription().testCount() == 0", but Description.testCount() is
> implemented to return 1 if there are no children.

Agreed.  I think in this case, there's a guard rail against the
accident waiting to happen, because TestClassRunner never returns an
atomic test.  The general case is disconcerting, and I'd appreciate a
tracker entry about it, but in the specific case, you should be able
to proceed with caution.

  David Saff
